instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a green light no power
threads.message:
got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in has a green light but no power.  i replaced the isl but still same green light. checked ppbus getting 7.5v on a low battery so g3h is good. can it only be the isl at this point?  

Thanks
Nate

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a green light no power
threads.message: Does the charger turns orange after a few seconds???

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a green light no power
threads.message: no it stays green with battery connected

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a green light no power
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a green light no power
threads.message: im testing on the <RESISTOR>R5450</RESISTOR> ppbus is giving 8.2v with only the charger connected

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a green light no power
threads.message: SMC is not running. Check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> and check corrosion around/under SMC.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a green light no power
threads.message: i replaced the <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> and now im getting 3.4v on <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> before it was not present.  checked ppbus and its still at 8.3v  i did an smc bypass by holding powre down and dropping charger on it and it resets but no fan spin.  could this still be the smc if the fan did not spin on the smc bypass?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a green light no power
threads.message: okay i replaced some components around the smc and got the light to go orange now and when i do an smc by pass the fan spins now. i changed out the smc and still the same thing, and 8.59v on ppbus.  possibly a bad smc i changed it out with or not well soldered maybe?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a green light no power
threads.message: fixed, was a bad smc from a donor board.
